document_data.name: Sixstar
document_data.mainbody:
'''Sixstar''' was one of the more luxurious neighborhoods found within the city of [[Ravens Bluff]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. The quiet and peaceful locale was full of three-and-four-story longhouses that had housed several generations of the [[Nobility of Ravens Bluff|city's nobility]]. There were few businesses within Sixstar and anyone that drew weapons too loud within its streets were quickly intercepted by the [[City Watch (Ravens Bluff)|City Watch]] and their war dogs they kenneled at the [[Redspires House]].

This neighborhood of the [[Uptown District]] garnered its name from the six-way intersection of [[Broken Bit Lane]], [[Fire Lane]] and [[MacIntyre Path]], a bit west of [[Lake Christina]].

Notable locations.Businesses:
*[[Malabaerthum's House]]: This foreboding stone building served as the headquarters of a merchant house of carvaneers that operated all throughout [[the Vast]].
*[[Nightbird House]]:
*[[Smokeflower House]]: The traders in this merchant's group shipped their goods to [[Tsurlagol]], [[Procampur]], and [[Altumbel]]. 
*[[Sparkling Edge|The Sparkling Edge]]:
Notable locations.Guildhalls:
*[[Hall of Five Arches]]:
*[[Seekers' Guildhall]]: This simple, sandstone building was home to the city's [[Diviners Guild|guild of divination]].
Notable locations.Landmarks:
*[[Lake Christina]]
*[[Raven Museum]]: While this impressive building housed a few interesting curios and notable antiquities, it largely served as storage for old city records that could no longer fit in the [[Oldover House]].
Notable locations.Residences:
*[[Anglund Hall]]: Previously owned by the [[DeSheers]], this massive [[granite]] estate, which was since purchased by the [[Emmerdin]] family, had sprawling gardens large enough to house a pair of [[pegasi]].
*[[Balathorp Towers]]:
*[[Longbottle Hall]]:
*[[Redspires House]]: The noble [[Cathone]] family lived in this magnificent red brick and sandstone manor.
*[[Rundelstones Manor]]:
*[[Seabreeze Hall]]:
*[[Stormgables House]]: The home of the [[Daradusk]] family was truly magnificent in appearance and over twice the size of other noble manors in the neighborhood.
Notable locations.Taverns, Inns and Restaurants:
*[[Maercrossan's]]:
*[[Shod Talon|The Shod Talon]]:
*[[Tavern of the Garden]]: A fanciful tavern and eatery that offered [[Tavern of the Garden wine]] and [[Silverymoon Blue]].{{Cite organized play/LC/Before Its Time|4}}
*[[Volodar's Stardust Inn]]:
Notable locations.Streets and Roads:
* [[Broken Bit Lane]]
* [[Dagger Street]]
* [[Fire Lane]]
* [[Lamorgyr's Ride]]
* [[Lis Lane]]
* [[MacIntyre Path]]
* [[North Road (Ravens Bluff)|North Road]]
* [[O'Kane Court]]
* [[Sylgarth Street]]
